title: Low-Carb Orange-Ginger Beef & Broccoli
description: A bright, low-carb stir-fry combining tender flank steak with crisp-tender broccoli in a savory orange-ginger sauce. Quick sautéing and a light citrus glaze make this a fresh, weeknight-friendly dinner that balances umami, acid, and warming spice.

ingredients.display_name: flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain
ingredients.notes: slice 1/8-1/4 inch thick; partially freeze 20 minutes for easier slicing
about 2 medium oranges; strain to remove pulp for a smoother glaze
dissolved in equal water to thicken; use xanthan for keto if desired

ingredients.display_name: olive oil (or avocado oil) for cooking

ingredients.notes: to season beef and broccoli water
optional for a touch of heat
white and green parts separated for cooking and garnish

steps.text: Prep: slice beef thinly against the grain, trim and cut broccoli into bite-size florets, mince ginger and garlic, zest and juice oranges, and slice green onions. Measure and set aside all sauce components.

Blanch broccoli: bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil, add broccoli and cook until bright green and just tender-crisp, about 2 minutes; plunge into an ice bath to stop cooking, drain and set aside.

Make sauce: combine strained orange juice, orange zest, minced ginger, minced garlic, tamari, rice vinegar, erythritol, and black pepper in a bowl. Taste and adjust acid/sweetness. Reserve arrowroot slurry separately.

Sear beef: heat a large heavy skillet or wok over high heat with one tablespoon oil until shimmering. Add beef in a single layer (work in batches if needed) and sear without moving until browned on one side, about 1-2 minutes, flip and cook another 30-60 seconds until just cooked through. Transfer beef to a plate and keep warm.
Aromatics: reduce heat to medium-high, add remaining oil to the pan, add white parts of green onion, ginger and garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30-45 seconds, taking care not to burn.

Combine and glaze: pour the prepared orange-ginger sauce into the pan, bring to a simmer, then add the arrowroot slurry while stirring to thicken. Simmer until glossy and slightly reduced, about 1-2 minutes.

Finish stir-fry: return seared beef and blanched broccoli to the pan, toss to coat evenly and heat through, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in sesame oil and optional red pepper flakes. Adjust seasoning with salt, tamari, or a squeeze of lime.
Rest and serve: transfer to a serving platter, garnish with sliced green onions and extra orange zest or lime wedges. Serve immediately.
